alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 20 at 5:37PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Bucks and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 533 PM EDT, flooding was ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The East Branch Perkiomen was quickly rising in Dublin. - For East Branch Perkiomen at Dublin: At 5:15pm the stage was 5.05 feet. Flood Stage is 5 feet. - This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 29 and 41. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
